intro: Senecio breyeri, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray flowers surrounded by a cluster of small, tubular florets. Senecio breyeri is adapted to survive in dry, sandy environments, with succulent leaves that store water. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is a hardy species that thrives in full sun.
